results.title: Spring comes to Kashmir
results.creator_credit: Ravi Prakash, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A panorama of spring in the mountains of Kashmir. The melting snows and running streams; the herders taking their beasts up to pastures; work beginning in the fields; smartening up the river boats for tourists; the gardens and orchards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ravi Prakash, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.description: A panorama of spring in the mountains of Kashmir. The melting snows and running streams; the herders taking their beasts up to pastures; work beginning in the fields; smartening up the river boats for tourists; the gardens and orchards.

results.title: Spring ball [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: At the Annual Senior Citizens Spring Ball another woman is named Spring Belle. Over the course of the evening, memories of friends lost as well as the lives that they’ve led will be shared. A powerful short film shot in Wagga about ageing with dignity and the era of Spring Dances and all they encompass. (Awards: Voted most popular Australian Short Film, Sydney Film Festival, 1993)

results.title: Spring's wild splendours
results.creator_credit: Norman G. Green and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Springtime, the wildflower season in Western Australia. Among the many flowering shrubs and plants are everlasting, leschenaultia, hovea, quandong, kangaroo paws and Sturt’s desert pea as well as the Christmas tree, several species of banksia and flowering eucalyptus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman G. Green and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.description: Springtime, the wildflower season in Western Australia. Among the many flowering shrubs and plants are everlasting, leschenaultia, hovea, quandong, kangaroo paws and Sturt’s desert pea as well as the Christmas tree, several species of banksia and flowering eucalyptus.

results.title: Spring
results.brief_description: Provides a series of visual impressions illustrating spring. Shows bare trees bursting into leaf, buds into flower and a profusion of colour appearing in gardens. No narration.

results.title: Spread your wings: making it with TAFE
results.creator_credit: John O'Shea, Chris Stewart, Technical and Further Education and Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film which is intended to provide information about the opportunities offered by Technical and Further Education in vocational training, and in recreational courses to meet community requirements. It is not intended to give detailed information on the breadth of courses and curricula but is rather a stimulus film aimed at encouraging enrolment.

results.title: Spray irrigation in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the advantages of spray irrigation over surface irrigation, and the various systems available for use with different types of crops.

results.title: Spotty: the fawn in winter
results.brief_description: Shows Spotty the fawn as he sees his first snow in the forest, and describes how a little girl who puts out food for the animals helps Spotty survive his first winter.
